titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the David Weynberg papers 1978.122
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-07 15:06:07 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Manhattan Terrace Civic Association (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: The David Weynberg papers include correspondence, legal documents, and photographs related to the Odd Fellows Home of the Long Island I.O.O.F. Home Association, the Brooklyn Philanthropic League and its Williamsburg Settlement, the Estate of Jane Murphy McCann, and the Manhattan Terrace Civic Association.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into five folders by subject.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: David Weynberg was an attorney at Smith and Weynberg, located at 16 Court Street in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); David Weynberg papers, 1978.122, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Fraternal organizations of Brooklyn collection (ARC.147), Series 4: Independent Order of Odd Fellows of New York State
Records of the Brooklyn Council for Social Planning (BCMS.0039), Williamsburg Settlement of the Brooklyn Philanthropic League

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The David Weynberg papers include correspondence, legal documents, and photographs related to the Odd Fellows Home of the Long Island I.O.O.F. Home Association, the Brooklyn Philanthropic League and its Williamsburg Settlement, the Estate of Jane Murphy McCann, and the Manhattan Terrace Civic Association.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

controlaccess.corpname: Manhattan Terrace Civic Association (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three receipts relating to 262 Neptune Avenue in Brighton Beach from the Great Eastern Coal Co. at 1148 Metropolitan Avenue, East Williamsburg.

did.unittitle: Appraisers report, estate of Jane Murphy McCann

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Prepared by Philip B. Masterson Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tax documents, correspondence, constitution and by-laws relating to the Williamsburg Settlement of the Brooklyn Philanthropic League, United Order True Sisters, Inc., 17-19 Montrose Avenue.

did.unittitle: Odd Fellows Home, Long Island I.O.O.F. Home Association

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents, correspondence, and oversize maps regarding an estate issue, property ownership, and by-laws for the Odd Fellows Home, Hollis, Queens.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A clipping, flyer, and set of black and white photographs documenting a zoning dispute in Midwood between the Manhattan Terrace Civic Association and a real estate developer seeking to build an apartment building.
